newsitem.title: USA: Starter Q2 sales to be hurt by weak market.
newsitem.headline: Starter Q2 sales to be hurt by weak market.

text.p: Starter Corp said Thursday it expects its second quarter sales will be hurt by continued market weakness.
Starter, which designs outerwear and activewear, said its order backlog is currently below last year's level.

"The company's sales continue to be negatively impacted by softness in our industry. As the industry has shifted towards a need to service the retailer on an 'at once' basis, we have focused on improving our responsiveness to meet their demands," Starter Chairman David Beckerman said in a prepared statement.
Starter said it adjusted its inventory so it includes basic items. This allows Starter to limit its inventory risk while still using its printing and embroidering capabilities, the company said.
Earlier, Starter posted a first quarter loss of $0.11 a share on net sales of $61.7 million, compared with a loss of $0.07 a share on net sales of $59.3 million.
